item.title: Chrome is still smashing the competition, commanding nearly 72% of the desktop browser market
item.itunes:title: Chrome is still smashing the competition, commanding nearly 72% of the desktop browser market
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
In the ongoing battle for browser dominance, it seems Google Chrome’s position is more secure than ever. According to the latest desktop market share data from Statcounter (via NeoWin) for the month of September 2025, Google Chrome has not only widened its massive lead, but has also surged to a new, all-time high.

This impressive growth comes at a time when all the major browsers are racing to integrate AI, and it’s a clear sign that Google’s strategy is resonating with users in a big way.

Xremove ads

The staggering numbers

The latest report shows Chrome’s desktop market share has jumped to a whopping 71.86%, a significant 2.6-point increase in just a single month. This growth appears to have come directly at the expense of its main competitors, who all saw their share decline. Here’s how the desktop browser market looked at the end of September:

  • Google Chrome: 71.86%
  • Microsoft Edge: 10.37%
  • Apple Safari: 5.69%
  • Mozilla Firefox: 4.93%

While Microsoft Edge holds onto a distant second place, both it and Safari saw notable drops. Perhaps most significantly, this new data shows Mozilla’s Firefox slipping below the 5% mark for the first time in a long while.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

Winning in the new AI era

This surge in market share comes right on the heels of Chrome’s biggest-ever AI update. The recent rollout of Gemini in Chrome, the smarter AI Mode in the omnibox, and the promise of new agentic capabilities have transformed the browser into a more proactive and intelligent tool.

While other browsers are also adding their own AI features, it seems Google’s deep integration and powerful models are helping to not just maintain but accelerate Chrome’s dominance. With its market share now approaching three-quarters of the entire desktop browser landscape, Google Chrome is truly in a league of its own.

item.title: Google opens up the Nest camera platform to third parties, starting with a $23 Walmart camera
item.itunes:title: Google opens up the Nest camera platform to third parties, starting with a $23 Walmart camera
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Amidst all the exciting new first-party hardware announced at Google’s smart home event today, one of the most strategically important pieces of news was a fundamental shift in philosophy. Google has announced that it is opening up its Nest camera platform and all of its new Gemini features to third-party hardware makers.

And this new era of openness is kicking off with a bang. The first partner in this new program is Walmart’s Onn brand, which is launching a new indoor camera with full Nest-level integration for the shockingly low price of just $22.96.

Xremove ads

A new ‘Built for Google Home’ vision

This is a massive and very welcome move away from the “walled garden” approach. Google stated that the best Gemini for Home experience “shouldn’t be limited to just one brand, form factor or price point,” signaling a new commitment to giving consumers more choice in their smart home hardware.

Nest features at Wyze prices

The first two products in this new partnership are available starting today, and their prices are incredibly aggressive.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads
  • Walmart Onn Indoor Camera Wired: $22.96
  • Walmart Onn Video Doorbell Wired: $49.86

The most important part of this announcement is the level of integration. These are not just “Works with Google Home” devices. They will feature full, deep integration, meaning you’ll set them up and control them entirely within the Google Home app.

Even more impressively, they will have access to all the same core features as first-party Nest Cams, including the powerful new Gemini camera features (like AI Descriptions and Home Brief) and cloud video recording via the new Google Home Premium subscription. It’s a “Nest-level experience at a Wyze-level price,” and it’s a huge win for consumers.

Buy the ONN Video Doorbell at Walmart
Buy the ONN Indoor Camera at Walmart

This is a brilliant and long-overdue move from Google that will bring more choice, more form factors, and a much lower cost of entry to the premium Google Home camera ecosystem. These first two Onn cameras are available today, and Google says this is just the beginning of wider partnerships to come.

Amidst all the exciting new first-party hardware announced at Google’s smart home event today, one of the most strategically important pieces of news was a fundamental shift in philosophy. Google has announced that it is opening up its Nest camera platform and all of its new Gemini features to third-party hardware makers.

And this new era of openness is kicking off with a bang. The first partner in this new program is Walmart’s Onn brand, which is launching a new indoor camera with full Nest-level integration for the shockingly low price of just $22.96.

Xremove ads

A new ‘Built for Google Home’ vision

This is a massive and very welcome move away from the “walled garden” approach. Google stated that the best Gemini for Home experience “shouldn’t be limited to just one brand, form factor or price point,” signaling a new commitment to giving consumers more choice in their smart home hardware.

Nest features at Wyze prices

The first two products in this new partnership are available starting today, and their prices are incredibly aggressive.

Featured Videos

  • Walmart Onn Video Doorbell Wired: $49.86

The most important part of this announcement is the level of integration. These are not just “Works with Google Home” devices. They will feature full, deep integration, meaning you’ll set them up and control them entirely within the Google Home app.

Even more impressively, they will have access to all the same core features as first-party Nest Cams, including the powerful new Gemini camera features (like AI Descriptions and Home Brief) and cloud video recording via the new Google Home Premium subscription. It’s a “Nest-level experience at a Wyze-level price,” and it’s a huge win for consumers.

item.title: The new Google Home app is finally here: faster, smarter, and redesigned for Gemini
item.itunes:title: The new Google Home app is finally here: faster, smarter, and redesigned for Gemini
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Alongside all the new hardware and the powerful new Gemini for Home intelligence, Google is rolling out the final, crucial piece of its smart home revitalization: a completely rebuilt and redesigned Google Home app. Based on user feedback, Google rebuilt the app from the ground up with three primary goals in mind: make it faster, more reliable, and finally, complete. This is the app that’s built to handle the new, powerful Gemini for Home experience, and it’s rolling out globally starting today.

Finally, a fast and reliable foundation

The number one piece of feedback Google heard from users was that before adding any new AI features, the app simply needed to be fast and reliable. This was Google’s top priority in the redesign, and the results are impressive.

Xremove ads

According to Google, the new app now loads significantly faster—over 70% faster on some Android devices—and app crashes are down by nearly 80% from just a few months ago. For camera users, live views now load 30% faster, and scrolling through your video history is far smoother with a more than 6x higher frame rate. This is the stable, responsive foundation many of us have been waiting for.

The best of the Nest app is now in one place

The second goal was to create a truly unified app, and that meant finally bringing the best of the Nest app into the Google Home experience. With this new update, you’ll no longer need to switch between apps. Full support for your core Nest devices and features is now here, including:

Featured Videos

Xremove ads
  • All Nest Thermostat models since 2015, with features like schedules.
  • Emergency smoke and CO alerts for Nest Protect.
  • Passcode management for the Nest x Yale Lock.

A new design built for Gemini

Finally, the app has been redesigned with a more intuitive layout that puts the power of Gemini at your fingertips. There’s a simplified three-tab layout (Home, Activity, Automations), and the “Ask Home” natural language command bar is now persistently accessible from the header as you move through the app. This makes it the central way to control devices, find camera clips, and even create complex automations just by describing what you want.

The camera experience has also been upgraded with rich, animated notification previews and new YouTube-like gestures, like double-tapping to fast-forward or rewind through your video history.

This is a massive and much-needed overhaul for the Google Home app. It’s faster, it’s unified, and it’s intelligently designed around the power of Gemini. The updates are starting to roll out globally today, so be sure to check your app for the new experience.

item.title: Google’s new Gemini for Home is a brilliant AI upgrade, but the best features will cost you
item.itunes:title: Google’s new Gemini for Home is a brilliant AI upgrade, but the best features will cost you
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
While the new hardware was the star of today’s Google smart home event, the real story is the software that powers it all. Google has officially detailed Gemini for Home, a new “foundational intelligence” that will replace the Google Assistant and fundamentally upgrade the smarts of your entire home ecosystem, from your speakers to your cameras to the Google Home app itself.

This is a massive leap forward, moving beyond a simple, transactional voice assistant to a truly collaborative and conversational AI partner for your home.

Xremove ads

A more natural conversation with your home

The most immediate change you’ll notice is in how you talk to your home. Gemini for Home introduces 10 new, more natural-sounding voices and, more importantly, a far better understanding of human conversation.

It can now maintain conversational context, so you don’t have to repeat yourself. If you ask about troubleshooting your dishwasher, your follow-up questions will be understood in that same context. It can also now handle complex requests with exceptions, a huge user request. You can finally say things like, “Hey Google, turn off all the lights, except for the office lights,” and it will just work. This new level of understanding extends to everything from finding a song based on a vague movie description to adding all the ingredients for a recipe to your shopping list with a single command.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

Your cameras finally get a brain

One of the most significant upgrades is how Gemini transforms your smart cameras from simple motion detectors into interpreters that can understand what they’re seeing. It’s the difference between a generic “person detected” alert and a truly helpful notification that says, “a USPS delivery driver is placing a package on the porch.” This new intelligence unlocks three powerful new camera features:

  • AI Descriptions: More detailed, narrative notifications that tell you the full story behind an alert.
  • Home Brief: An automatic, digestible summary of your day’s important events, complete with relevant video clips, delivered each evening.
  • Ask Home for Video History: You can now search your entire video history with natural language, asking things like, “Did I leave the car door open?”

‘Ask Home’ makes automation easy for everyone

This new natural language understanding is also coming to the Google Home app with a feature called Ask Home. While you can use it to control devices, its most powerful new capability is creating automations. What was once a niche, power-user feature is now accessible to everyone. You can simply describe what you want in plain English—like “Create an automation to turn on the porch lights and lock the front door every day at sunset”—and Gemini will build it for you.

How you’ll get it (and what it will cost)

This is a massive update, and Google is rolling it out in a few different ways. The entire experience will begin with an early access program that you can sign up for in your Google Home app settings, with the rollout starting this month. Here’s how the features break down:

Xremove ads
  • The Free Upgrade: The core Gemini for Home voice assistant—the more conversational, better-understanding AI with new voices—will be a free upgrade that replaces the Google Assistant on your existing speakers and displays.
  • The Paid Subscription: The most advanced, proactive features will require a new Google Home Premium subscription starting at $10/month. This includes Gemini Live, all the new AI camera features (AI Descriptions, Home Brief, Ask Home for video), and the ability to create automations with Ask Home.

This is a huge and ambitious new chapter for the Google Home ecosystem. While the new subscription model is a significant change, the sheer power and utility of these new Gemini features make this the most exciting development for Google’s smart home in years.

item.title: Google unveils new 2K Nest Cams and the ‘Google Home Speaker’ built for Gemini
item.itunes:title: Google unveils new 2K Nest Cams and the ‘Google Home Speaker’ built for Gemini
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Today, Google made good on its promise to reinvest in the Nest ecosystem. The company just unveiled a whole new portfolio of devices built from the ground up for the new Gemini for Home experience, including three new 2K Nest Cams and a Doorbell, and the brand-new Google Home Speaker.

New Nest Cams and Doorbell get a 2K Gemini-powered upgrade

The entire wired camera lineup has received a massive and much-needed hardware refresh. The new Nest Cam Indoor (3rd gen), Nest Cam Outdoor (2nd gen), and Nest Doorbell (wired, 3rd gen) all now feature 2K HDR video, delivering the best image quality ever on a Nest camera.

Xremove ads

On top of the resolution bump, the new cameras also feature wider fields of view and greatly improved low-light performance thanks to new sensors. This upgraded hardware is what unlocks the new, powerful Gemini for Home camera features, including more detailed notifications (like “dog jumps out of playpen”), the ability to search your video history with natural language (“What happened to the vase in the living room?”), and “Home Brief,” which summarizes hours of footage into a quick, digestible summary.

Even better, Google is improving the features that are included right out of the box with no subscription required. All the new cameras now come with six hours of event video history, doubling the three hours offered on the previous generation.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

The new Nest Cam Indoor ($99.99), Nest Cam Outdoor ($149.99), and Nest Doorbell ($179.99) are all available for purchase starting today.

The new Google Home Speaker is built for Gemini

Alongside the new cameras, Google also unveiled the new Google Home Speaker, the first audio device designed specifically for the more powerful and conversational Gemini for Home assistant.

The speaker features custom processing for faster, more fluid interactions with Gemini, and a new, expressive light ring that provides visual feedback to show you when Gemini is listening, thinking, or responding. It’s designed to deliver balanced, 360-degree audio for room-filling sound.

Xremove ads

And in a huge win for home theater fans, Google is finally delivering a long-requested feature: you can now pair two Google Home Speakers with a Google TV Streamer to create a true surround-sound audio setup.

The new Google Home Speaker comes in four new colors (Porcelain, Hazel, Jade, and Berry). However, you’ll have to wait a bit for this one. It’s set to launch in Spring 2026 for $99.

This is a fantastic and much-needed hardware refresh that puts Gemini at the very center of the Google Home experience. It’s a great day for anyone invested in Google’s smart home ecosystem.

Today, Google made good on its promise to reinvest in the Nest ecosystem. The company just unveiled a whole new portfolio of devices built from the ground up for the new Gemini for Home experience, including three new 2K Nest Cams and a Doorbell, and the brand-new Google Home Speaker.

New Nest Cams and Doorbell get a 2K Gemini-powered upgrade

The entire wired camera lineup has received a massive and much-needed hardware refresh. The new Nest Cam Indoor (3rd gen), Nest Cam Outdoor (2nd gen), and Nest Doorbell (wired, 3rd gen) all now feature 2K HDR video, delivering the best image quality ever on a Nest camera.

Xremove ads

On top of the resolution bump, the new cameras also feature wider fields of view and greatly improved low-light performance thanks to new sensors. This upgraded hardware is what unlocks the new, powerful Gemini for Home camera features, including more detailed notifications (like “dog jumps out of playpen”), the ability to search your video history with natural language (“What happened to the vase in the living room?”), and “Home Brief,” which summarizes hours of footage into a quick, digestible summary.

Even better, Google is improving the features that are included right out of the box with no subscription required. All the new cameras now come with six hours of event video history, doubling the three hours offered on the previous generation.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

The new Nest Cam Indoor ($99.99), Nest Cam Outdoor ($149.99), and Nest Doorbell ($179.99) are all available for purchase starting today.

The new Google Home Speaker is built for Gemini

Alongside the new cameras, Google also unveiled the new Google Home Speaker, the first audio device designed specifically for the more powerful and conversational Gemini for Home assistant.

The speaker features custom processing for faster, more fluid interactions with Gemini, and a new, expressive light ring that provides visual feedback to show you when Gemini is listening, thinking, or responding. It’s designed to deliver balanced, 360-degree audio for room-filling sound.

Xremove ads

And in a huge win for home theater fans, Google is finally delivering a long-requested feature: you can now pair two Google Home Speakers with a Google TV Streamer to create a true surround-sound audio setup.

The new Google Home Speaker comes in four new colors (Porcelain, Hazel, Jade, and Berry). However, you’ll have to wait a bit for this one. It’s set to launch in Spring 2026 for $99.

This is a fantastic and much-needed hardware refresh that puts Gemini at the very center of the Google Home experience. It’s a great day for anyone invested in Google’s smart home ecosystem.

item.title: Google Drive is getting powerful new ransomware protection and a one-click file recovery tool
item.itunes:title: Google Drive is getting powerful new ransomware protection and a one-click file recovery tool
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Ransomware is one of the most terrifying and destructive threats on the modern web. The idea that a malicious actor could encrypt all your important files and hold them hostage is a nightmare for both individuals and businesses. In a fantastic new update, Google is rolling out two powerful new features for Google Drive, currently in beta, designed to detect a ransomware attack and help you recover your files with ease.

How the new protection works

The new system works with a smart, two-pronged approach for users of Google Drive for desktop. First is Ransomware detection. Drive will now monitor for suspicious activity on your computer. If it detects a potential ransomware attack in progress, it will automatically pause all file syncing. This is a crucial first step, as it quarantines the threat and prevents the encrypted, malicious files from overwriting the clean versions stored in your cloud. The user and their Workspace administrator will be notified immediately.

Xremove ads

The second part is a new, user-friendly File restoration tool. In the event of an attack, this new interface allows a user to select multiple files at once and easily restore them to a clean, unencrypted version from a specific point in time before the attack happened. This gives users a powerful way to recover their data without having to consider paying a ransom.

Who gets these new features?

This is the most important part of the announcement. The powerful new file restoration tool will be available to all Google Drive users, including those with personal Google accounts and Workspace Individual subscribers. This is a massive win for everyone.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

The proactive ransomware detection feature, however, will be limited to users on specific Google Workspace business and education plans, including Business Standard/Plus and Enterprise tiers.

These new features are a fantastic and much-needed security upgrade for Google Drive. The admin controls are rolling out now, and the detection and restoration tools will begin their gradual roll-out to end-users on October 14, 2025.

item.title: Google Drive’s best AI feature is no longer chained to your desktop
item.itunes:title: Google Drive’s best AI feature is no longer chained to your desktop
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
The “Collaborate with Gemini” feature in Google Drive for the web is an incredibly powerful tool. The ability to have a conversation with your files—summarizing documents, synthesizing information across folders, and pulling out quick facts—has been a game-changer for research and productivity. But up until now, that power has been a desktop-only experience.

That’s finally changing. In a new post on the Workspace Updates blog, Google has announced that it is now extending Gemini’s full capabilities to the Google Drive apps for both Android and iOS.

Xremove ads

Your AI research assistant, now on the go

This is a fantastic update that makes Gemini in Drive a far more versatile and useful tool. The same powerful, conversational AI that can analyze your files and folders on the web is now available right on your phone, allowing you to be productive and find information no matter where you are. With this new mobile integration, you can use Gemini to:

  • Summarize a long document or an entire folder to quickly get the main points while you’re on the go.
  • Discuss a topic by asking questions that require synthesizing information from multiple files in your Drive.
  • Retrieve quick facts about a project or topic without having to manually hunt for and read through the relevant documents.

This is a much-needed update that brings one of Drive’s best AI features to the mobile apps where so many of us do our work. The feature is part of an extended roll-out that began on September 22nd, so it should be appearing for eligible users soon. It’s available to most paid Workspace subscribers, Google AI Pro for Education users, and Google One AI Premium subscribers.

item.title: You can now edit images in Google Slides and Vids with Nano Banana
item.itunes:title: You can now edit images in Google Slides and Vids with Nano Banana
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
The pace of AI feature roll-outs in Google Workspace has been relentless, and the latest update brings a massive upgrade to the creative tools in both Google Slides and Google Vids. A new, more powerful image editing model is here, and with it comes the much-anticipated ability to edit your images using custom, natural language prompts.

A more powerful AI model under the hood

First up, the underlying AI is getting a big power-up. Google is upgrading the image editing capabilities in Slides and Vids to its latest model, codenamed “Nano Banana.” This is the same state-of-the-art model that recently brought huge improvements to image editing in the main Gemini app, known for its higher-quality outputs and better character consistency.

Xremove ads

Edit images with your words

The most exciting part of this update is the new feature this model unlocks: custom prompting. Instead of being limited to pre-set options and filters, you can now select any image in your presentation or video project, click “Edit image,” and simply type a description of the changes you want to make.

Google gives the perfect example: you can ask Gemini to “Place this product in a New York subway station,” and it will generate a new image with that background, which you can then insert directly into your slide. This is a massive leap forward in creative control, moving beyond simple tweaks to a truly open-ended editing experience right where you work.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

This powerful new feature is currently rolling out to most paid Workspace subscribers, Google AI Pro for Education users, and Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. It’s a fantastic upgrade that makes creating professional-looking visuals for your presentations and videos easier and more flexible than ever before.

item.title: Google’s ‘G’ logo is getting a company-wide makeover to reflect the new AI era
item.itunes:title: Google’s ‘G’ logo is getting a company-wide makeover to reflect the new AI era
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
For the past decade, Google’s iconic, flat, four-color “G” has been a ubiquitous symbol across the web and our devices. It’s been a clean, simple, and instantly recognizable mark for the company. But as Google continues its massive shift into the new era of AI, its most prominent logo is now getting a refresh to match.

In a new blog post, Google has announced that it is officially adopting its brighter, four-color gradient “G” as the new company-wide icon, representing all of Google’s brand and corporate identity.

Xremove ads

Symbolizing the AI era

If the new logo looks familiar, it’s because you’ve likely already seen it. Google first introduced this brighter, gradient style earlier this year to represent Google Search, and a similar design language was used for the Gemini spark icon. Now, that new look is officially taking over.

According to Google, this isn’t just a simple design refresh; it’s a symbolic move to “visually reflect our evolution in the AI era.” The company explains that the “brighter hues and gradient design symbolize the surge of AI-driven innovation and creative energy” across all its products. It’s a clear and very public signal of Google’s full commitment to an AI-first future, baked right into its core branding.

Xremove ads

Rolling out everywhere soon

This change will be a bit of a gradual one. Google says it will continue to update the logo across more of its products, platforms, and services over the coming months. item.title: This new TSA-friendly Anker power bank can charge two laptops and a phone at once
item.itunes:title: This new TSA-friendly Anker power bank can charge two laptops and a phone at once
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
After first being unveiled at IFA 2025 last month, Anker’s most powerful portable battery is now officially available for purchase. The new Anker Prime Power Bank (26k, 300W) is a true powerhouse designed for travelers or anyone like me with multiple power-hungry devices. And to celebrate the launch, Anker is offering a solid introductory discount for the next six days, dropping the price from its $229.99 MSRP to just $184.

What makes this portable power bank special is that Anker has packed an incredible amount of power into a travel-friendly package. The 26,250mAh capacity translates to 99.75Wh, keeping it just under the TSA’s 100Wh limit for carry-on luggage.

Xremove ads

But the real headline is the power delivery. This bank has a total output of 300W, delivered through two USB-C ports capable of 140W each, plus an additional 22.5W USB-A port. In practical terms, that’s enough juice to fast-charge two power-hungry Chromebooks and a phone all at the same time.

Just as impressively, those USB-C ports are bi-directional, allowing for a combined input of 250W. Anker claims this can take the battery from empty to 80% in just 35 minutes, which is a game-changer. You can monitor all this activity on the battery’s built-in screen or via the Anker mobile app.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

Anker seriously continues to push the boundaries of what’s possible with portable power, and this new Prime Power Bank looks to be an absolute beast. If you’re interested in picking one up, be sure to grab it while the limited-time launch discount is still active!

item.title: I was ready to buy a Kindle until I saw TCL’s new 8-inch NXTPAPER tablet
item.itunes:title: I was ready to buy a Kindle until I saw TCL’s new 8-inch NXTPAPER tablet
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Over the last several years, I’ve done almost all of my reading on my phone. It’s convenient, sure, but it’s far from an ideal experience. That’s why I’ve recently found myself seriously considering a dedicated e-reader, with the Kindle Paperwhite sitting at the top of my list as the standard, go-to option. But just as I was getting ready to pull the trigger, a new device from TCL has popped up that has piqued my interest!

The new TCL TAB 8 NXTPAPER 5G isn’t trying to be just an e-reader. Instead, it’s a compact, full-fledged Android tablet built around a unique, eye-friendly display. And while my primary use for it would be reading, it’s that added flexibility and versatility that has me completely rethinking my purchase.

Xremove ads
Check out Today’s Best Chomebook Deals

A display that does things differently

The star of the show here is the 8.7-inch NXTPAPER 4.0 display. Unlike a standard glossy tablet screen, the glass is etched with a fine pattern, giving it a matte finish that dramatically reduces glare and reflections.

And with the press of a dedicated key, you can cycle the display through different modes: full color, a warmer reading mode with muted tones, and a fully monochromatic black-and-white mode that mimics the look of an e-ink screen.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

The perfect Kindle competitor?

With its unique display and compact size, TCL is clearly positioning the Tab 8 as a more flexible alternative to color e-readers like the Kindle Colorsoft. And on paper, the advantages are clear. At $199.99, it’s significantly cheaper than the $280 Kindle. Its upgraded LCD panel offers far better color reproduction than the Kindle’s muted E Ink screen.

And most importantly, because it runs Android 15, you have access to the entire Google Play Store. You can read books from the Kindle app, Kobo, or your local library, then switch over to watch a YouTube video or browse the web—something no dedicated e-reader can do.

But to hit that compelling price point, there are some expected trade-offs. The tablet is powered by an unspecified octa-core processor with just 4GB of RAM and 64GB of storage, which is on the low end for a modern Android device. This isn’t a tablet for high-end gaming or heavy multitasking.

Xremove ads

The other major trade-off is battery life. While TCL touts a respectable 16 hours of mixed usage from the 6,000mAh battery, that’s a far cry from the multi-week battery life of a dedicated e-reader. But that’s the core of the compromise: the Tab 8 does far more than an e-reader, so it naturally requires more power.

For $199.99 exclusively at Verizon (coming soon to Total Wireless), the TCL TAB 8 NXTPAPER 5G is not trying to be the most powerful tablet on the market. Instead, it’s carving out a fascinating new niche for users like me who want a single, portable, and connected device for reading, light media consumption, and browsing, all with a strong focus on eye comfort.

item.title: The big Pixel Buds Pro 2 Feature Drop is here with Adaptive Audio and head gestures
item.itunes:title: The big Pixel Buds Pro 2 Feature Drop is here with Adaptive Audio and head gestures
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Following their big debut at the Made by Google 2025 event, the exciting new software features for the Pixel Buds Pro 2 are now officially rolling out. A new firmware update (version 4.467) is beginning to arrive for users, and it’s a true Feature Drop, bringing a host of smart new capabilities that make Google’s flagship earbuds even better.

Meet ‘Adaptive Audio’ and Loud Noise Protection

The headline feature of this update is a brand-new noise control mode called Adaptive Audio. Sitting alongside the existing Noise Cancellation and Transparency modes, Adaptive Audio is an intelligent middle ground. It dynamically reduces the volume of unwanted, sustained background noises—like the hum of a metro or the clatter of a gym—while still keeping you aware of your immediate surroundings.

Xremove ads

When Adaptive Audio is active, it also enables Loud Noise Protection, a fantastic feature that automatically reduces the volume of sudden, loud sounds like a passing fire truck’s siren to help protect your hearing.

Truly hands-free with new head gestures

This update also introduces a truly hands-free way to interact with calls and texts. With new head gestures, you can now simply nod your head to answer an incoming call or reply to a text message, and shake your head to decline a call or dismiss the reply. It’s a brilliant addition for those moments when your hands are full. It is worth noting, however, that Google says this specific feature will be rolling out over the next few weeks, so it may not be available immediately after your firmware is updated.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

Clearer conversations with Gemini Live

Finally, the update brings an improvement to your interactions with Gemini. The Pixel Buds Pro 2 will now use advanced audio processing to better prioritize your voice and eliminate background noise, ensuring your conversations with Gemini Live are clearer and more uninterrupted, even when you’re in a noisy environment.

This is a fantastic and feature-packed update that makes the Pixel Buds Pro 2 smarter and more capable than ever. The new firmware will roll out to all users automatically over time, but you can check for it manually in the Pixel Buds app by heading to More settings > Firmware update and looking for version 4.467.

Meet ‘Adaptive Audio’ and Loud Noise Protection

The headline feature of this update is a brand-new noise control mode called Adaptive Audio. Sitting alongside the existing Noise Cancellation and Transparency modes, Adaptive Audio is an intelligent middle ground. It dynamically reduces the volume of unwanted, sustained background noises—like the hum of a metro or the clatter of a gym—while still keeping you aware of your immediate surroundings.

Xremove ads

When Adaptive Audio is active, it also enables Loud Noise Protection, a fantastic feature that automatically reduces the volume of sudden, loud sounds like a passing fire truck’s siren to help protect your hearing.

Truly hands-free with new head gestures

This update also introduces a truly hands-free way to interact with calls and texts. With new head gestures, you can now simply nod your head to answer an incoming call or reply to a text message, and shake your head to decline a call or dismiss the reply. It’s a brilliant addition for those moments when your hands are full. It is worth noting, however, that Google says this specific feature will be rolling out over the next few weeks, so it may not be available immediately after your firmware is updated.

Clearer conversations with Gemini Live

Finally, the update brings an improvement to your interactions with Gemini. The Pixel Buds Pro 2 will now use advanced audio processing to better prioritize your voice and eliminate background noise, ensuring your conversations with Gemini Live are clearer and more uninterrupted, even when you’re in a noisy environment.

This is a fantastic and feature-packed update that makes the Pixel Buds Pro 2 smarter and more capable than ever. The new firmware will roll out to all users automatically over time, but you can check for it manually in the Pixel Buds app by heading to More settings > Firmware update and looking for version 4.467.

item.title: YouTube Premium is getting even better with new features for all platforms
item.itunes:title: YouTube Premium is getting even better with new features for all platforms
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
While the ad-free experience is the main draw for most YouTube Premium subscribers, the service also comes with a host of other perks and experimental features designed to enhance your viewing experience. In a new announcement, YouTube has confirmed that several of these great features are now graduating from their experimental phase and expanding to more of the devices you use every day.

Better viewing on the big screen and the web

Some of the most exciting expansions are coming to the non-mobile YouTube experience. First up, the fantastic “Jump ahead” feature, which uses AI to let you seamlessly skip to the most interesting or relevant parts of a video, is now fully available on Smart TVs and Gaming Consoles. This is a huge quality-of-life improvement for the living room experience.

Xremove ads

For those of you who watch on a desktop or Chromebook, the more granular faster playback speeds are now fully available on the web. This allows you to fine-tune playback up to 4x speed in precise 0.05 increments, a feature that was previously only available on mobile.

Finally, the “High-quality audio” option, which provides a richer listening experience for official music videos, is now a standard, fully available feature for both Android and iOS in the main YouTube app, graduating from its experimental status.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

New Shorts perks for iOS users

Premium subscribers who use an iPhone are also getting a couple of great new features for Shorts, bringing the iOS app to parity with its Android counterpart. Shorts Smart Downloads, which automatically saves Shorts for offline viewing based on your watch history, is now fully available on iOS. Additionally, Shorts Picture-in-Picture (PiP) is also making its full debut, allowing you to keep a Short playing in a small window while you browse other content.

This is a great set of updates that adds even more value to the YouTube Premium subscription. It’s fantastic to see YouTube continuing to roll out thoughtful, useful perks for its paying members across all the different platforms we use to watch.

item.title: Gemini in Google Sheets is now a formula-writing genius that explains its own work
item.itunes:title: Gemini in Google Sheets is now a formula-writing genius that explains its own work
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
For many of us, writing complex spreadsheet formulas can feel like learning a new language. It can be an intimidating and frustrating process of trial and error. In a fantastic new update, Google is making that process a whole lot easier by rolling out a significant upgrade to formula generation in Gemini for Sheets. This new version isn’t just smarter at writing formulas; it can now explain how they work and even fix them when they break.

Your personal AI formula tutor

The first part of this upgrade turns Gemini into your personal formula tutor. Now, when you ask Gemini to generate a complex formula, it can also return a detailed, step-by-step explanation of how the formula works. This is a huge learning tool that helps you understand the logic behind the calculation, making it easier for you to trust the result and adapt the formula for future use.

Xremove ads

An AI that can explain and fix formula errors

This next part is a game-changer for anyone who has ever stared at a #REF! or #VALUE! error in frustration. Gemini can now explain why a formula failed in plain, natural language (e.g., “the date in A1 is formatted as text”).

Even better, in a follow-up turn, it can use that error message to generate a corrected formula that solves the underlying issue. This interactive troubleshooting will save users a massive amount of time and headaches.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

More than one way to solve a problem

Finally, for more complex tasks where there might be several ways to get the same result, Gemini can now provide you with multiple different formula options. This gives you more flexibility and control over how your spreadsheet works.

This is a fantastic set of upgrades that makes Gemini in Sheets an even more powerful and accessible tool. The focus on not just generating formulas but also helping users understand and troubleshoot them is a brilliant move. The best part is this update is already available for all eligible users, which includes most paid Workspace subscribers, Google AI Pro for Education users, and Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers.

item.title: Bryson DeChambeau is partnering with Google Cloud to put AI in every golfer’s pocket
item.itunes:title: Bryson DeChambeau is partnering with Google Cloud to put AI in every golfer’s pocket
item.itunes:author: Chrome Unboxed[RSS+]
item.itunes:summary:
Bryson DeChambeau is known as “The Scientist” of golf for a reason. He’s one of the biggest names in the sport, not just for his major wins, but for his relentless, methodical, and meticulous approach to optimizing every single aspect of his game. From custom-designed club heads to AI-powered biomechanics analysis, DeChambeau is always pushing the boundaries.

Now, he’s taking that pursuit to the next level by partnering with Google Cloud to explore how AI can revolutionize sports performance. And the goal isn’t just to help him; it’s to put that same advanced AI coaching power into the hands of every golfer.

Xremove ads

AI that can refine your swing in minutes

DeChambeau has already been using an AI coaching tool that studies the finest points of his biomechanics. But the partnership with Google Cloud aims to expand these AI aspirations even further, with a specific focus on developing a version of this AI coach that could run on a smartphone.

The vision is to provide near-instant, on-course feedback that can help golfers make real-time adjustments. As DeChambeau puts it, he’s “making interpretations and iterating on my golf swing with the data that’s presented to me, minutes before my tee time.” Imagine having that kind of precise, data-driven insight available instantly.

Featured Videos

Xremove ads

Bringing complex AI to the masses

This partnership highlights the incredible potential of Google Cloud’s AI to move beyond massive datasets and into personalized, on-demand applications. By leveraging Google’s powerful AI models, the goal is to take a technology that was once complex and exclusive and make it far more accessible.

While DeChambeau is applying this to his golf swing, the implications are huge. This kind of mobile, real-time AI coaching could be applied to virtually any sport or physical activity, democratizing access to expert-level analysis and feedback. It’s a fascinating collaboration that could fundamentally change how athletes of all levels train and perform.

You can learn more about this exciting partnership on Google Cloud’s “Transform” blog that showcases the initiative. It’s a great example of how cutting-edge AI can be applied to push the boundaries of human performance.
